text: Activation of <extra_id_0> TLR4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - Mediated NFkappaB Signaling in Hemorrhagic Brain in Rats
Inflammation and immunity play a crucial role in the pathogenesis of Intracerebral hemorrhage ( ICH ) .

<extra_id_0> Toll-like receptor 4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - ( <extra_id_0> TLR4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - ) mediated nuclear factor kappa-B ( NFkappaB ) signaling plays critical roles in the activation and regulation of inflammatory responses in injured brain .
However , the involvement of <extra_id_0> TLR4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated NFkappaB signaling in the pathogenesis of ICH remains unknown .

The present study was to evaluate the temporal profile of the expression of <extra_id_0> TLR4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the activation of <extra_id_0> TLR4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated NFkappaB signaling in brain tissues of Wistar rats after ICH .

<extra_id_0> TLR4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA and protein , the phosphorylation of <extra_id_0> inhibitors of kappa B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( p - <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) , and the activity of NFkappaB were examined in hemorrhagic cerebral tissue by Rt-PCR , Western blots , immunohistochemistry staining , and EMSA .

Compared with saline control , the <extra_id_0> TLR4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA and protein significantly increased starting at 6 hours after ICH , peaked on the 3rd day after ICH , and then decreased but still maintained at a higher level on the 7th day after ICH ( P < .05 ) .
The level of p - <extra_id_0> IkappaBalpha <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and the activity of NFkappaB also increased in the brain after ICH compared with saline control .

The present study firstly suggests that <extra_id_0> TLR4 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - mediated NFkappaB signaling participates in the pathogenesis of ICH , which may become a therapeutic target for ICH - induced brain damage .
